intro: Mammillaria pilispina, commonly known as the white-furred hedgehog cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a distinctive appearance characterized by its white, woolly spines. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-15 centimeters and features a ribbed stem. It produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Mammillaria pilispina is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
